name: Economics
description: Within Social Sciences, Journalism and Information / Social and behavioural sciences, Economics is the study of economic policy, economic theory, and economic decision-making, including production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services. [cite: 115, 116]

name: Econometrics
description: The application of statistical methods to economic data to give empirical content to economic relationships, a specialized area within Economics. [cite: 116]

name: Economic history
description: The study of how economic phenomena evolved in the past, a branch of Economics. [cite: 116]

name: Political economics
description: The study of production and trade and their relations with law, custom, and government, as well as with the distribution of national income and wealth, an interdisciplinary field related to Economics. [cite: 116]
